data.title: Ghost Tour Pleasing Terrors
data.text: We went on ghost tour called Pleasing Terrors with a tour guide named Mike Brown. He is a native to Charleston and has been giving tours for 20 years. He gives a mix of history and ghost stories and shares about his research and experiences with the supernatural. His tour was excellent. He also has a podcast out with other researched stories that we listened to on our ride home that were really great. If you are into ghost tours then this is the one for you! We did not see anything supernatural on our tour but weren't really expecting too. It's lots of fun to hear stories that Mike shares.

data.title: Very knowledgable on many subjects
data.text: We, 6 adults, enjoyed our 2.5 hour private tour of mainly the French Quarter of Charleston with Dennis Stiles. He was accurately informed about the writers, poets , musicians and artists and their local history as well as the Revolutionary and Civil War events that happened here. I highly recommend him.

data.title: AWESOME WALKING GHOST TOUR
data.text: Mike is awesome! So captivating and really tells the story. He has clearly done his research so whether or not you believe in ghosts, haunted houses, etc. he explains the stories that have been shared and then gives a logical explanation of why these people may have encountered what they did. 100% recommended!

data.title: Ghost Tour from Washington Park at 7:30
data.text: Other people in my group were very enthused to do the Ghost Tour (generally not my thing). I have to say the tour was very interesting and included quite a bit of unique Charleston history. It was fun walking around Charleston at night and seeing some of the spookier places. I could not give this an excellent because there were 2 dogs along on the tour who would lick my leg, get in the way and bark (with the owners telling them to be quiet). I would suggest not allowing dogs on the tour. Otherwise it was excellent.

data.title: Immerse Yourself in Charleston History
data.text: Denny took time to get to know us so he could tailor the tour to fit our interests.  We were impressed by his knowledge of local, state and national history that he presented in a charming way.  It was our first day in Charleston, and we felt like this tour gave us a good grounding in the city and the important sites.  We thoroughly enjoyed this personalized tour!

data.title: Denny IS Charleston at its best!
data.text: Just 5 days ago, while Hurricane Matthew was still in the Caribbean and only a possibility for the Carolina coast, my husband, daughter and I were privileged to share a carefree few hours with Denny Stiles of Old Charleston Walking Tours. Our trip was in celebration of our daughter's 25th birthday...she holds a Master's in Architecture with a Certificate in Preservation and loves all things preservation related. Denny's tour had been highly recommended to us years ago by Susan Sully. She was oh so right on every level! Denny's love for his long ago adopted home was evidenced in every step he took and every nugget of Charleston history, architecture and lore he shared with us. At one point he apologized for going a bit over the advertised length of the tour...we replied that he could 'walk us forever'. One can see the love he has for this magnificent city in his kind smile, gentle way and ready response to our every question. Our tour did not end on that gorgeous Sunday afternoon...we have brought it home with us where we shall each reminisce for years to come! Our hearts go out to Charleston and all the areas possibly to be affected by Matthew....and especially Denny and his family. May his tours soon be carrying on.... Old Charleston Walking Tours and Denny Stiles....extraordinary!

data.title: Great ghost tour!
data.text: This was such a fun tour!  Walking around Charleston at night visiting the historic sites and listening odd and spooky stories was such fun.  The guide is excellent and has such a great delivery with the stories he tells.  He has researched the stories and gives a great explanation of the history behind them.

data.title: I'm very glad I didn't cancel
data.text: My wife and I booked the 9:30 pm pleasing terrors ghost tour with Mike Brown.  We had a long day and around time to leave I thought about blowing it off.  My wife convinced me otherwise and we went.  It was a perfect night for a ghost tour; cool with winds blowing. Mike was a master story teller who was convincing in his belief.  The stories were intriguing and they made the trip.  AT one point, my wife shouted out that there was a flickering light in a window (probably and faulty electrical problem -- or was it??).  In any event, this was one of the highlights on the trip and I am glad I went.

data.title: Awesome
data.text: Mike did a great job. It was very interesting and so much fun! Highly recomend!  The walk is 90 min but goes quick because you're so intrigued!

data.title: Great Tour
data.text: Attended the 9:30pm tour with a large party of 8. The tour was kid friendly and easy to walk. Questions were welcomed by the group and everyone walked away intrigued to learn more about this fascinating city.

data.title: Less talking, more sight seeing...
data.text:
I was really excited about this tour, but....  

I take advantage of any opportunity I have to learn more about the civil war and visit historical sights, but after spending the first full hour (of a two hour tour) listening to a lot of political discussion and having only visited one actual location, I knew it was going to be a long morning. The tour ran over by 30-45 minutes and while the guide was very, very nice and extremely knowledgable, it was just too much talking and too little sight seeing, which ended up getting all crammed into the last 45 minutes of the trip.

data.title: Awesome approach to a ghost tour
data.text:
We did the 9.30pm tour with Mike Brown (Pleasing Terrors). It made us smile how we would be having a normal chat with Mike and then when it came to telling us about a ghost or haunting, he switched to his 'story telling' voice - it was brilliant! Straight away you were captivated by him. He doesn't try and scare you, he just tells you everything he knows and has learnt about particular hauntings and sightings from various interviews he has conducted and research he has done.
We thoroughly enjoyed the 90 min tour and recommend it to anyone who wants to learn a little more about the hauntings of Charleston.
We now also subscribe to Mike's 'Pleasing Terrors' podcast. Very interesting guy.

data.title: Wonderful evening out with friends.
data.text: The guide was excellent!  I honestly felt he believed in the ghosts he was talking about.  I got the chills a couple of times.  It was a fun evening.

data.title: Ghost Tour - Pleasing Terrors
data.text: I took the early (7:30 p.m.) 90 minutes ghost tour with Mike Brown.  I thoroughly enjoyed the tour which was informative and thought-provoking. There was one young boy on our tour who was scared, but the rest of us were simply fascinated. This is a dog-friendly tour, and I had my dog Vienna with me.

data.title: Enjoyable Night Out
data.text: My husband brought me to Charleston for my birthday, and this was one of my gifts. We did the pleasing terrors ghost tour with Mike, and it was a great experience.  I really enjoy history, so Mike was great at incorporating history into all the stories.  I actually hate horror and scary stuff, so I was pleasantly surprised at how Mike approaches ghost stories. I enjoyed listening to Mike and all he had to say, but I think I would have enjoyed him more if I had heard him do a more historical tour. Again, I'm not a huge horror fan, so ghosts aren't exactly my cup of tea, but Mike was great and told enough history to not lose my interest and to not leave me up all night long! I would take one of Mike's tours again, and would love to hear him talk about other sections of Charleston!

data.title: Great ghost tour and pet friendly!
data.text: It was creepy, great stories, and we loved that we were able to bring our 2 small dogs.  Guide was very knowledgable.  We loved the tour.

data.title: Best ghost tour I've been on
data.text:
Mike is a GREAT story-teller. I love that he uses history and research to enrich the ghost stories he tells. Very interesting - Keeps you on the edge of your seat!

I've been on several other ghost tours (Denver, Stanley Hotel, New Orleans and Savannah to name a few). This is definitely one of the best.

data.title: Ghost Tour
data.text: Excellent walking tour of 'haunted' sections of Charleston .  Mike Brown has an exceptional oratory gift with relaying the haunted history of each area! Definitely recommend!

data.title: Actual goosebumps on a sweltering hot evening!
data.text: My husband and I went on a 7:30 ghost tour with Mike on Tuesday, August 2.  Mike's method is to collect stories from locals, and then research locations and names to determine historic context and possible origins and causes of hauntings, and then shares his findings on the tour.  This makes for a fascinating look into the history, locations, and people of Charleston.  He's an excellent storyteller....and even my very very skeptical husband loved the tour!

data.title: Great Ghost Tour
data.text: Excellent tour full of interesting stories and history.  Guide was extremely knowledgeable and entertaining.  Although it is a walking tour, it is not too strenuous to do in the summer heat.  Not too scary for families but my teens really enjoyed it!
